snippet: When Rosh Hashana comes early and the school year starts a week late as a result, New York parents have been known to panic and quickly make plans to fill the gap.
abstract: School district in New York City and many suburbs have postponed opening day a full week after Labor Day, because of early arrival of Rosh Hashana; many parents have to call relatives or friends to back them up in the days ahead or steal a few vacation days from their jobs, actions that represent their own odd breaking of traditional cycles of work and play.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and KYLE SPENCER

lead_paragraph: When Rosh Hashana comes early and the school year starts a week late as a result, New York parents have been known to panic and quickly make plans to fill the gap.

headline.main: Extra Week of Summer Break? Time to Panic
headline.print_headline: Extra Week of Summer Break? Time to Panic
